alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 4:56PM MDT until July 15 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry gulches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Rainfall amounts of 0.4 to 0.8 inches in an hour are expected over the area south of Highway 14 and along and west of Pingree Park road. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Larimer County - This includes the following additional locations... Monument Gulch, Jacks Gulch, Lower Pingree Park Road, Sky Ranch and Crown Point Road.
info.instruction: Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
